testlist.question: What is the difference between a class and an object?
testlist.questionDescription: Explain the difference between a class and an object in object-oriented programming.

questions.questionText: What is the difference between a class and an object?

choices.choiceText: A class is a blueprint for objects, and an object is an instance of a class.
A class is an instance of an object, and an object is a blueprint for classes.
A class is a function, and an object is a variable.
A class is a variable, and an object is a function.

questions.questionText: What is encapsulation in object-oriented programming?

choices.choiceText: Encapsulation is the concept of wrapping data and methods that operate on the data within a single unit.
Encapsulation is the ability of a class to inherit properties and methods from another class.
Encapsulation is the process of creating a new class from existing classes.
Encapsulation is the concept of defining multiple methods with the same name but different parameters.

questions.questionText: What is inheritance in object-oriented programming?

choices.choiceText: Inheritance is the concept of creating a new class from an existing class.
Inheritance is the ability of a class to inherit properties and methods from another class.
Inheritance is the process of wrapping data and methods within a single unit.
Inheritance is the concept of defining multiple methods with the same name but different parameters.
